com.explodingbacon.bcnlib.utils

Class PIDController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.explodingbacon.bcnlib.utils.PIDController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class PIDController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    All-encompassing PID controller that can be used for rate and for position control. Set any tuning parameter to 0 to disable that parameter.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PIDController.Mode

      Creates a new PIDController object with given values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PIDController

        public PIDController(Motor m,
                     edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Encoder e,
                     PIDController.Mode mode,
                     int kP,
                     int kI,
                     int kD)
        Creates a new PIDController object with given values, using the defaults for min and max motor target.
        Parameters:
        m - Motor to actuate.
        e - Encoder to read.
        mode - The mode to run the controller in (RATE or POSITION)
        kP - Proportional tuning variable. Set to 0 to disable the P term.
        kI - Integral tuning variable. Set to 0 to disable to I term.
        kD - Derivative tuning variable. Set to 0 to disable the D term.

      • PIDController

        public PIDController(Motor m,
                     edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Encoder e,
                     PIDController.Mode mode,
                     int kP,
                     int kI,
                     int kD,
                     double min,
                     double max)
        Creates a new PIDController object with given values.
        Parameters:
        m - Motor to actuate.
        e - Encoder to read.
        mode - The mode to run the controller in (RATE or POSITION)
        kP - Proportional tuning variable. Set to 0 to disable the P term.
        kI - Integral tuning variable. Set to 0 to disable to I term.
        kD - Derivative tuning variable. Set to 0 to disable the D term.
        min - The minimum target to the motor. Values below this will be scaled down to 0.
        max - The maximum target to the motor. Values above this will be scaled to this value.

    • Method Detail

      • enable

        public void enable()
        Enables control of the motor.

      • disable

        public void disable()
        Disables control of the motor.

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(int target)
        Set a new position target.
        Parameters:
        target - Position target in encoder clicks from encoder zero

      • getTarget

        public int getTarget()
        Get the currently set target.
        Returns:
        Position target in encoder clicks from encoder zero

      • getCurrentError

        public int getCurrentError()
        Get the difference between the target and the current position, in encoder clicks.
        Returns:
        The current error, in encoder clicks

      • resetPosition

        public void resetPosition()
        Reset the encoder to zero.

        NOTE: This will reset the encoder object EVERYWHERE it is used.

      • reTune

        public void reTune(double kP,
                   double kI,
                   double kD)
        On-the-fly re-tuning of the loop. Be careful here, there shouldn't be any reason to use this except to tune. For safety, this disables and resets the PIDController
        Parameters:
        kP - Proportional tuning variable. Set to 0 to disable the P term.
        kI - Integral tuning variable. Set to 0 to disable to I term.
        kD - Derivative tuning variable. Set to 0 to disable the D term.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
